author: Special Correspondent
text:
A total of 992 candidates including 870 Ph.D. scholars will receive their degrees in person from Governor Konijeti Rosaiah on Saturday during the 23rd convocation of Manonmaniam Sundaranar University.

Speaking to reporters here on Thursday, Registrar A. John De Britto, and member of MSU Conveners’ Committee Prof. Radhakrishnan Nair said 992 candidates would receive their degrees in person from the Governor on Saturday and 45,982 others would get the degrees in absentia.

Of the total 46,974 candidates to be awarded their degrees in person and in absentia, 870 persons are Ph.D. scholars (men - 345 and women - 525) and 1,219 candidates are M.Phil. scholars – four men and 29 women will receive their degrees in person while 1,186 others will receive in absentia.

In the post-graduates section, 14,480 candidates including 2 men and 45 women, both in person, and 14,433 in absentia, will get the degrees and 30,405 students including 3 men, 39 women, both in person as they are rank-holders, and 30,363 students will receive their degrees in absentia. “Four students have bagged double gold medals for their stupendous performance in the examinations,” Dr. Britto said.

On the delay in delivering final verdict by the MSU in the sexual harassment charges levelled by a few girl students against faculty member Vinodh Vincent Rajesh of Department of History, Dr. Radhakrishnan Nair said he had been placed under suspension for the past six months following preliminary enquiry. “We can assure you that appropriate action will be taken if charges are proved,” Dr. Nair said.

Controller of Examinations of MSU Prabakar and another member of conveners’ committee P. Govindaraju were present.
title: MSU convocation tomorrow
